hedline.hl1: APPLE SLIPS, GATEWAY AND COMPAQ GAIN

abstract.p: Media Metrix survey shows Apple's Macintosh computers lost ground in American households last year; says 3.8 million households owned Macs in January, compared with 4.1 million a year earlier; finds that for first time, Gateway and Compaq Computer are leading brands of Windows PC's in American homes, each in about 5.4 million homes, followed by previous leader, Packard-Bell, with 5.2 million; graph (S)

block.p: Despite the success of its iMac model, Apple's Macintosh computers lost ground in American households last year, according to a survey being released today by Media Metrix, the Web market-tracking company. The Media Metrix survey shows that 3.8 million households owned Macs in January, compared with 4.1 million a year earlier and 4.9 million in 1996. In a separate survey, Media Metrix found that for the first time, Gateway and Compaq Computer are the leading brands of Windows PC's in homes in the United States, each in about 5.4 million homes, followed by the previous leader, Packard-Bell, with 5.2 million.
